Music, the greatest good that mortals know, And all of heaven we have below.

A man who is good enough to go to heaven is not good enough to be a clergyman.
A man's reach should exceed his grasp, or what's heaven for?
A single grateful thought toward heaven is the most perfect prayer.
Adversity is the diamond dust Heaven polishes its jewels with.
Ah, but a man's reach should exceed his grasp - or what's a heaven for?
Ah, but a man's reach should exceed his grasp, or what's a heaven for?

And seeing ignorance is the curse of God, Knowledge the wing wherewith we fly to heaven.

Be still, my soul, be still; the arms you bear are brittle,
Better to reign in Hell, than serve in Heaven.
Between us and heaven or hell there is only life, which is the frailest thing in the world.
Bless was it in that dawn to be alive,/But to be young was very heaven.
Bliss was it in that dawn to be alive,
Children are living jewels dropped unsustained from heaven.
Children are the hands by which we take hold of heaven.
Christianity supplies a Hell for the people who disagree with you and a Heaven for your friends.
Complaint is the largest tribute heaven receives.
Confess yourself to heaven; repent what's past; avoid what is to come.
Courage leads to heaven; fear leads to death.
Death and life have their determined appointments; riches and honors depend upon heaven.
Democracy is only a dream: it should be put in the same category as Arcadia, Santa Claus, and Heaven.
Despair is the damp of hell, as joy is the serenity of heaven.
Did universal charity prevail, earth would be a heaven, and hell a fable.
Do your duty and leave the rest to heaven.
Every charitable act is a stepping stone toward heaven.
Every charitable act is a stepping stone towards heaven.
Every man is as heaven made him, and sometimes a great deal worse.
Every man must get to Heaven his own way.
Everybody wants to go heaven, but nobody wants to die.
Everybody wants to go to heaven, but nobody wants to die.
Give all thou canst; high Heaven rejects the lore of nicely-calculated less or more.
Go to Heaven for the climate, Hell for the company.
God has two dwellings; one in heaven, and the other in a meek and thankful heart.
God owns heaven but He craves the earth.
God walked down the stairs of heaven with a Baby in His arms.
He who does evil that good may come, pays a toll to the devil to let him into heaven.
Heaven and Hell suppose two distinct species of men,
Heaven cannot brook two suns, nor earth two masters.
Heaven finds an ear when sinners find a tongue.
Heaven for climate, Hell for company.
Heaven gives its glimpses only to those not in position to look too close.
Heaven goes by favor; if it went by merit, you would stay out and your dog would go in.
Heaven grant us patience with a man in love.
Heaven has no rage like love to hatred turned, Nor hell a fury like a woman scorned.
Heaven is a state of mind, not a location, since Spirit is everywhere and in everything.
Heaven is as the book of God before us set, wherein to read his wondrous works.
Heaven is so far of the mind that were the mind dissolved - the site of it by architect could not again be proved.
Heaven is under our feet as well as over our heads.
Heaven lies about us in our infancy and the world begins lying about us pretty soon afterward.
Heaven lies about us in our infancy! Shades of the prison-house begin to close upon the growing boy.
Heaven must be an awfully dull place if the poor in spirit live there.
Heaven never helps the men who will not act.
Heaven will be inherited by every man who has heaven in his soul.
Heaven will be no heaven to me if I do not meet my wife there.

Help yourself, and Heaven will help you.
Home interprets heaven. Home is heaven for beginners.
I don't like to commit myself about heaven and hell - you see, I have friends in both places.
I don't want to go to heaven. None of my friends are there.
I would rather go to heaven alone than go to hell in company.
If Heaven had looked upon riches to be a valuable thing, it would not have given them to such a scoundrel.
If I am not allowed to laugh in heaven, I don't want to go there.

In Heaven all the interesting people are missing.
In Heaven an angel is nobody in particular.

Love seeketh not itself to please,
Love should be a tree whose roots are deep in the earth, but whose branches extend into heaven.
Many might go to Heaven with half the labor they go to hell.
Marriage is neither heaven nor hell, it is simply purgatory.
Marriages are made in heaven and consummated on Earth.
Men at most differ as Heaven and Earth, but women, worst and best, as Heaven and Hell.
Music is God's gift to man, the only art of Heaven given to earth, the only art of earth we take to Heaven.
My idea of heaven is a great big baked potato and someone to share it with.
No man can resolve himself into Heaven.
No one is worthy of a good home here or in heaven that is not willing to be in peril for a good cause.
Nothing is further than earth from heaven, and nothing is nearer than heaven to earth.
Nothing is too high for the daring of mortals: we storm heaven itself in our folly.
O! for a muse of fire, that would ascend the brightest heaven of invention.
Of all the inventions of man I doubt whether any was more easily accomplished than that of a Heaven.
On earth there is no heaven, but there are pieces of it.
Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie, which we ascribe to heaven.
Parting is all we know of heaven and all we need of hell.
Pennies do not come from heaven - they have to be earned here on earth.
Pennies do not come from heaven. They have to be earned here on earth.
Remorse: beholding heaven and feeling hell.

Spires whose silent finger points to heaven.
Sunsets are so beautiful that they almost seem as if we were looking through the gates of Heaven.
Thank Heaven, the sun has gone in, and I don't have to go out and enjoy it.
The bottom line is in heaven.
The Christian idea of a perfect heaven that is something other than a non-existence is a contradiction in terms.

The poet's eye, in a fine frenzy rolling, doch glance from heaven to earth, from earth to heaven.

There are more things in heaven and earth, Horatio, Than are dreamt of in your philosophy.
There may not be a Heaven, but there is a San Francisco.

Thoughts are the gun, words are the bullets, deeds are the target, the bulls-eye is heaven.
Thwackum was for doing justice, and leaving mercy to Heaven.
To different minds, the same world is a hell, and a heaven.
To love is to receive a glimpse of heaven.

Tomorrow is the day when idlers work, and fool reform, and mortal men lay hold on heaven.
